meanings.definition: The upper layer of soil, typically rich in nutrients and organic matter.
meanings.sent1: Farmers plant seeds in the topsoil to help crops grow.
meanings.sent2: Gardening experts recommend adding compost to enrich the topsoil in your garden.
meanings.sent3: The topsoil was so fertile that even the rocks wanted to become plants!
meanings.sent4: The topsoil is like a nourishing blanket for the earth, feeding all living things.
meanings.sent5: After the rain, the topsoil smelled fresh and full of life.

meanings.definition: To cover with or as if with topsoil.
meanings.sent1: The landscaper will topsoil the garden to prepare it for planting.
meanings.sent2: We need to topsoil the lawn before laying down new grass seeds.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally topsoiled my shoes while working in the garden!
meanings.sent4: The construction workers topsoiled the area, readying it for the new building.
meanings.sent5: The farmer carefully topsoiled the field, ensuring the soil was evenly distributed.
